infoList.title: Mall Hours

additionalInfo.details: Strollers are available for a nominal fee at the TD Entrance (Entrance #1). Single and double strollers are available. The cost is $4.00 for singles, and $5.00 for doubles.
additionalInfo.title: Strollers

additionalInfo.details: Complimentary wheelchairs and walkers are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Photo identification is required.
additionalInfo.title: Wheelchair & Walkers

additionalInfo.details: Shop with your gift card at 21 shopping centres nationwide! Offering the perfect gift has never been easier. The Bayshore gift card is welcomed by the mall's hundreds of participating retailers.
additionalInfo.title: Bayshore Gift Cards

additionalInfo.details: Please visit the Mall Security office located on the first level by the washrooms (Entrance #5) if you are in need of a First Aid Kit.
additionalInfo.title: First Aid

additionalInfo.details: A large, comfortable nursing room is available through the women's washroom in the Food Court. There is also a nursing room in the first level family washrooms.
additionalInfo.title: Nursing Room

additionalInfo.details: Lost or found an item during your visit? Be sure to contact Guest Services. Found items are transferred and tracked at Guest Services, where they are kept for a period of 30 days.
additionalInfo.title: Lost & Found

infoList.subtitle: Get in touch with our friendly customer service staff
infoList.title: Guest Services
infoList.details: At Bayshore, we are committed to providing you with an exceptional shopping experience. Our knowledgeable staff is proud to offer many complimentary and fee services to make your shopping experience memorable.

infoList.subtitle: See public transit information and schedules
infoList.details: Bayshore is easily accessible from all corners of the city via public transit with its own main bus terminal. Look for main OC Transpo routes 61, 62, 85, and 97. The centre is a short 20-minute ride from downtown Ottawa. In 2021, the city's new LRT system will extend to Bayshore station.
infoList.title: Public Transportation
Tourist Information Booth
infoList.subtitle: Discover Ivanhoé Cambridge
infoList.details: Need traveling tips? The Tourist Information Booth is in operation from May to September and is run by the City of Burnaby.  It's located beside the Food Court on the Upper Level.

infoList.title: Accessibility
infoList.subtitle: Ivanhoé Cambridge is committed to excellence in serving all customers
infoList.details:
Ivanhoé Cambridge is committed to excellence in serving all customers and is an easily-accessible, one level shopping centre with:

A Simple-to-Navigate Racetrack Design
Automatic Sliding Doors
Easily Accessible Washrooms
76 Prime Designated Accessible Parking Spaces
Complimentary Wheelchairs and Scooters
A Telecommunication Teletypewriter (TTY) (available at the Guest Services kiosk)

Complimentary wheelchairs and motorized scooters are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Photo Identification and valid credit card are required. Please note that scooters with a battery life of two green bars or less will not be rented out within two hours of the mall closing.

Located in the rapidly growing western portion of the Ottawa-Gatineau area, Bayshore is a super-regional shopping centre, home to an exciting mix of over 190 retailers. Stylishly designed over three levels, the centre includes a variety of the hottest stores on the market.
infoList.subtitle: Learn more about Bayshore
infoList.title: About Bayshore
